Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the exterior, worn, is covered with a brown slip and faint traces of several lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394903) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394903)
